video_description:
http://logiclounge.com/2012/07/10/mac-os-x-mountain-lion-review-gold-master/
On July 9th, 2012 Apple released the Mac OS X Mountain Lion Gold Master (GM) to its developers to put thorough its final paces before being released to the public. Since this is basically the final version before it's released to consumers what we seen in this version of Mountain Lion will be in the public release unless something major and catastrophic happens. With over 200 new features in Mountain Lion we can't squeeze them into a short enough video so today we'll be outlining only the major players.
title: Apple OS X Mountain Lion (10.8) GM Review

No you shouldn't, you need to go to Preferences and "Mail, Contacts, & Calendars" and sign in with your Facebook account. 

Right now the Facebook plugin﻿ is in developer preview so it's a separate download.
comments.author: logiclounge

comments.text:
The identified developers isn't a list, it's a string that you get generated from Apple﻿ when you are in the Developer Program and you enter it into your code. 

That list is managed by Apple and not your computer.

comments.text: It's largely unchanged from all the Mac installation videos.﻿ You accept the Terms of Service, it installions, it asks you to signup or signin into iCloud and that's basically it.

comments.text: Right now for Gold Master, the Facebook setting has to be downloaded and installed separately because that﻿ feature is in beta. If you go to your developer account, right under the Mountain Lion download is the Facebook download.
